channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Exclusive: Ex-Meta AI leaders debut an agent that scours the web for you in a push to ultimately give users their own digital ‘chief of staff’
item.description: The founding trio behind Yutori—backed by Radical Ventures, Fei-Fei Li, and Jeff Dean—aims to reinvent how we interact with the internet, starting wit...

item.title: Meta Is Creating a New A.I. Lab to Pursue ‘Superintelligence’
item.description: The new lab, set to include the Scale AI founder Alexandr Wang, is part of a reorganization of Meta’s artificial intelligence efforts under Mark Zucke...

item.title: Employee confidence amongst entry-level workers just hit an all-time low
item.description: Entry-level workers are feeling the brunt of economic uncertainty and it’s leading to an overall decline in job confidence.

item.title: As Energy Costs Surge, Eastern Governors Blame a Grid Manager
item.description: Anger at PJM, which manages the electrical grid in all or parts of 13 states and the District of Columbia, has been boiling over in some state capital...

item.title: European Union Unveils Fresh Sanctions on Russia, Including a Nord Stream Ban
item.description: Ursula von der Leyen, president of the European Commission, announced a proposal meant to ramp up pressure on Moscow.

item.title: Exclusive: Laurel raises $100 million Series C to map where the time goes
item.description: Laurel has raised a $100 million Series C led by IVP, Fortune has exclusively learned. The deal values the startup at $510 million.

item.title: U.K., Australia, Canada and Others Impose Sanctions on Far-Right Israeli Ministers
item.description: The coordinated move highlights the hardening of several countries’ stance toward Israel amid the dire humanitarian crisis in Gaza.

item.title: The LA Clippers are building the future of tech in sports, with facial recognition powering a new fan experience
item.description: Halo Sports and Entertainment CEO Gillian Zucker says consumers don't mind facial recognition—when it's called something else.

item.title: Paramount is laying off over 600 U.S. workers in its second downsizing effort in the past year
item.description: Latest round of layoffs follow two waves of cuts last year.

item.title: European Union Unveils Fresh Sanctions on Russia, Including a Nord Stream Ban
item.description: Ursula von der Leyen, president of the European Commission, announced a proposal meant to ramp up pressure on Moscow.

item.title: Trump and Newsom Skewer Each Other After National Guard Deployment to LA Protests
item.description: President Trump said that Gov. Gavin Newsom should be arrested for his governance of California, while Mr. Newsom issued a barrage of retorts online.

item.title: At Least 9 Dead After Austria School Shooting, Police Say
item.description: The victims names and ages have not been released. The police said the gunman also died, in an apparent suicide. The attack is among the worst school ...

item.title: U.K., Australia, Canada and Others Impose Sanctions on Far-Right Israeli Ministers
item.description: The coordinated move highlights the hardening of several countries’ stance toward Israel amid the dire humanitarian crisis in Gaza.

item.title: US and China Talk Trade as Fight Over Rare Earths Escalates
item.description: Officials from the world’s largest economies will try to strike a deal Tuesday to relax painful export restrictions that they have imposed on each oth...

item.title: Israel Deports Greta Thunberg and Other Activists on Gaza Aid Boat
item.description: The environmental campaigner was sent home after she and others on the intercepted ship said they were trying to deliver food and medical supplies.
